sen.j: 源 光行（みなもと の みつゆき、長寛元年（1163年） - 寛元2年2月17日 (旧暦)（1244年3月27日））は、鎌倉時代初期の政治家・文学者・歌人である。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Mitsuyuki (1163-April 3, 1244)was a politician, literary scholar and poet of the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 原文中の新暦はユリウス暦だったため、グレゴリオ暦に改めました。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Mitsuyuki (1163 - April 3, 1244) was a politician, literary scholar and poet during the early Kamakura period.
MINAMOTO no Mitsuyuki (1163 - April 3, 1244) was a politician, literary scholar and poet during the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）に平安京にいた光行は、平家方であった父の源光季の謝罪と助命嘆願のため、鎌倉市に下向した。
sen.e: In 1183, Mitsuyuki, who was in Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan, present-day Kyoto) at that time, went to Kamakura city to submit a petition for apology and the life of MINAMOTO no Mitsusue, his father who had been on the Taira family's side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 原文「鎌倉市」とありますが、当時の鎌倉と現在の鎌倉市は完全に一致しているわけではないので、ここは「鎌倉」が正しいのではと思います。ひとまず原文通り”Ｋａｍａｋｕｒａ City”として訳しています。
sen.e: In 1183, Mitsuyuki, who was in Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan, present-day Kyoto) at that time, went to Kamakura city to submit a petition of apology and to spare the life of MINAMOTO no Mitsusue, his father who had been on the side of the Taira family.

In 1183, Mitsuyuki, who was in Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan, present-day Kyoto) at that time, went to Kamakura city to submit a petition of apology and to spare the life of MINAMOTO no Mitsusue, his father who had been on the side of the Taira family.

sen.j: 叔父の源季貞の助命を嘆願していた従兄弟の源宗季と共に源頼朝に助命を願った。
sen.e: With his cousin 源宗季 who had been begging for the life of his uncle MINAMOTO no Suesada, he appealed to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo for mercy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 原文人名「源宗季」、「みなもとのむねすえ」ではないかと思われますが読みが史料にて確定できませんでしたので、漢字のままにしております。
sen.e: With his cousin 源宗季, who had been begging for the life of his uncle MINAMOTO no Suesada, he appealed to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo for mercy.
sen.cmt: The translator comments that the Kanji may be read as "MINAMOTO no Munesue", but leaves it out due to lack of confirmation. It seems, however, it may be better to put that reading in rather than leave the English reader clueless.
sen.e: With his cousin 源宗季, who had been begging for the life of his uncle MINAMOTO no Suesada, he appealed to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo for mercy.

sen.j: その結果は定かではないが、頼朝にその才能を愛されて、そのブレーンとなった。
sen.e: Although the result is unknown, he was favored by Yoritomo because of his talent and became his advisor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the result of this is unknown, he was favored by Yoritomo because of his talent and became his advisor.
Although the result of this is unknown, he was favored by Yoritomo because of his talent and became his advisor.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府が成立すると、政所の初代別当となり、朝廷と幕府との関係を円滑に運ぶ為に、鎌倉・京都間を往復した。
sen.e: When the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) had come into power, he was appointed as the first betto (director) of the Mandokoro (Administrative Board), and frequently went back and forth between Kamakura and Kyoto to make and keep the relationship between the Imperial court and the bakufu running smoothly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) had come into power, he was appointed as the first betto (director) of the Mandokoro (Administrative Board), and frequently went back and forth between Kamakura and Kyoto to make and keep the relationship between the Imperial court and the bakufu running smoothly.

When the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) had come into power, he was appointed as the first betto (director) of the Mandokoro (Administrative Board), and frequently went back and forth between Kamakura and Kyoto to make and keep the relationship between the Imperial court and the bakufu running smoothly.

sen.j: 一方で、幕府の高官でありながら、朝廷からも河内守、大和国守に任命された。
sen.e: Meanwhile, he was appointed as the governor of Kawachi Province and the governor of Yamato Province by the Imperial court although he was a high-ranking officer of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(三文に分割）
sen.e: Meanwhile, he was appointed as the governor of Kawachi Province and the governor of Yamato Province by the Imperial court, despite already being a high-ranking officer of the bakufu.
Meanwhile, he was appointed as the governor of Kawachi Province and the governor of Yamato Province by the Imperial court, despite already being a high-ranking officer of the bakufu.

sen.j: 結果として後の承久の乱の際に去就を迷い、後鳥羽天皇方に従ってしまった。
sen.e: As a result of that, later, at the time of the Jokyu war, he was unable to decide which side he would support and ended up following the party of the Emperor Gotoba.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(三文に分割）原文「後鳥羽天皇」とありますが、1198年に譲位しているため承久の乱勃発（1221）当時は上皇でした。ひとまず訳出では原文通り、天皇にしておりますが、ご確認願います。
sen.e: As a result of this, later, during the time of the Jokyu war, he was unable to decide which side he would support and ended up following the party of the Emperor Gotoba.
As a result of this, later, during the time of the Jokyu war, he was unable to decide which side he would support and ended up following the party of the Emperor Gotoba.

sen.j: が、この際も、その才能を惜しんだ人々の助命嘆願のおかげで、重刑を免れた。
sen.e: However, even under these circumstances, he avoided being sentenced to a severe punishment thanks to the petitions of people who were reluctant to lose his talents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(三文に分割）

sen.j: 源氏物語の研究者で源氏物語の注釈書であるいわゆる「河内本」の著者。
sen.e: He was a scholar of The Tale of Genji and the author of the so-called 'Kawachi-bon manuscript', a commentary on The Tale of Genji.
He was a scholar of The Tale of Genji and the author of the so-called 'Kawachi-bon manuscript', a commentary on The Tale of Genji.

sen.j: 北条泰時の命で和歌所・学問所などを設置した。
sen.e: He set up offices such as the wakadokoro (the Office of Waka) and gakumonjo (shogunal lecture group) by the order of Yasutoki HOJO.
He set up offices such as the wakadokoro (the Office of Waka) and gakumonjo (shogunal lecture group) by the order of Yasutoki HOJO.

sen.j: 『若宮社歌合』（建久2年（1191年）3月3日）の企画者とされている。
sen.e: He is regarded as one of the planners of the "Wakamiya no yashiro no uta-awase" (a poetry contest held at the Wakamiya no yashiro shrine, on April 5, 1191).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 学説上この「若宮社」がどこにあったかについて諸説あるようなので、訳出では"Wakamiya no yashiro shrine"としました。
sen.e: He is regarded as one of the planners of the "Wakamiya no yashiro no uta-awase" (a poetry contest held at the Wakamiya no yashiro shrine, on April 5, 1191).

sen.j: 史料には「前大和守従五位上源朝臣光行」と記載されていることから、二十歳代で大和守になっていたことがわかる。
sen.e: According to historical materials where he is recorded as 'the former governor of Yamato Province, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), MINAMOTO no Asomi Mitsuyuki' it is known that he had already served as the governor of Yamato Province in his twenties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 朝臣の読み、あそみかあそんか不明
sen.e: According to historical materials in which he is recorded as 'the former governor of Yamato Province, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), MINAMOTO no Asomi Mitsuyuki' it is discerned that he had already served as the governor of Yamato Province in his twenties.
